intro: Krokia oligantha, commonly known as the slender krokia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a unique appearance. Krokia oligantha is often found in fynbos vegetation, showcasing its adaptation to the Mediterranean climate of the region.
